caption:
Table 6. We can 
see that without position encoding, the performance drops 

significantly. With absolute position encoding, the perfor-
mance is higher than without. Relative position encoding 
yields the highest performance. When relative position en-
coding is added only to the attention generation branch (first 
term in Eq. 3) or only to the feature transformation branch 
(second term in Eq. 3), the performance drops again, in-
dicating that adding the relative position encoding to both 
branches is important.
